messages.message:
Not getting expected response for a HR policy query from Search.
• The response varies significantly between UAT and prod environments also. 
• Response refers a source document which is unrelated. 
Can we look into what is happening? @Hari @Rakesh
USA People team chatbot provides the expected correct response

For UAT vs Prod, how much can I spend question - are you keeping selection as "all drives"?

`The global travel and expense policy doc` is not indexed earlier in any of environments - mainly none of Ask Benji docs were in either Engg or HR drive.
I am going to place them in engg shared drive for indexing and get them reindexed - then this query for business meal expense should work.

Yes, selection is all drives in both the cases.

Thanks for confirming that the document is not present. We should add all the source docs for the Instabase chatbot docs to the Search corpus. cc: @avi

Arguably, all org chatbot knowledge should automatically accrue to search for an org OR search should federate to appropriate chatbots :slightly_smiling_face: Or at least there should be a setting for it. Can think about this in Q4.
For near term, are you suggesting to do a one time pull of all the docs and add them to search? cc: @Balaram @Rakesh

Yes, in the near term we should do a one time pull of the docs and add to Search corpus.

Agree that we should think about the scenarios where Search can leverage org chatbots to enhance the user experience

We should decide if we create new data sources for these - since some of these chat bot docs may not belong to either of current indexes drives ? What is complete list of chat bots we need to index  @avi
